title: Authors and Citation
text: Farrow M (2026). fundr: Fundraising Analytics Helpers. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/mattfarrow1/fundr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {fundr: Fundraising Analytics Helpers},   author = {Matt Farrow},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/mattfarrow1/fundr}, }

title: Fundraising Analytics Helpers
text: goal fundr provide lightweight, tidyverse-compatible utilities fundraising advancement analytics, minimal required dependencies.

title: Fundraising Analytics Helpers
text: can install development version fundr GitHub :

title: Fundraising Analytics Helpers
code: library(fundr)  dates <- as.Date(c("2024-06-30", "2024-07-01"))  fy_year(dates, fy_start_month = 7) #> [1] 2024 2025  fy_label(dates, fy_start_month = 7) #> [1] "FY24" "FY25"  fy_quarter(dates, fy_start_month = 7) #> [1] 4 1

what: Optional: Load Google Fonts for Plotting
title: Fundraising Analytics Helpers
code: fundr_use_google_font("Montserrat", family = "montserrat")  ggplot2::ggplot(mtcars, ggplot2::aes(wt, mpg)) +   ggplot2::geom_point() +   theme_fundr()

title: fundr: Fundraising analytics helpers — fundr-package
text: Utility functions reference tools fundraising advancement analytics, designed tidyverse-compatible minimal required dependencies.

title: fundr: Fundraising analytics helpers — fundr-package
text: Maintainer: Matt Farrow matt@mattfarrow.co

what: Ensure a Google Font is available for plotting — fundr_use_google_font
title: Ensure a Google Font is available for plotting — fundr_use_google_font
text: Downloads/registers Google Font via sysfonts enables showtext rendering font works reliably across devices.

title: Ensure a Google Font is available for plotting — fundr_use_google_font
Ensure a Google Font is available for plotting — fundr_use_google_font
text: name Google Fonts family name (e.g., "Montserrat") family family name reference ggplot2 (e.g., "montserrat") enable_showtext TRUE, calls showtext::showtext_auto() ... Passed sysfonts::font_add_google() (e.g., db_cache = TRUE)

what: Fiscal year label for a date — fy_label
title: Fiscal year label for a date — fy_label
text: Fiscal year label date

title: Fiscal year label for a date — fy_label
Fiscal year label for a date — fy_label
text: date Date (something coercible via .Date()). fy_start_month Integer 1-12. Default 7 = July fiscal year start. prefix Prefix label (default "FY"). short TRUE, uses 2-digit year (e.g., "FY26"); otherwise "FY2026".

title: Fiscal year label for a date — fy_label
text: Character vector fiscal year labels.

what: Fiscal quarter for a date — fy_quarter
title: Fiscal quarter for a date — fy_quarter
text: Quarters numbered 1-4 within fiscal year defined fy_start_month.

title: Fiscal quarter for a date — fy_quarter
Fiscal quarter for a date — fy_quarter
text: date Date (something coercible via .Date()). fy_start_month Integer 1-12. Default 7 = July fiscal year start.

title: Fiscal quarter for a date — fy_quarter
text: Integer vector (1-4).

what: Fiscal year for a date — fy_year
title: Fiscal year for a date — fy_year
text: Fiscal year returned year fiscal period ends. example, July start (fy_start_month = 7), 2024-07-01 FY2025. January start (fy_start_month = 1), fiscal year matches calendar year.

title: Fiscal year for a date — fy_year
Fiscal year for a date — fy_year
text: date Date (something coercible via .Date()). fy_start_month Integer 1-12. Default 7 = July fiscal year start.

title: Fiscal year for a date — fy_year
text: Integer fiscal year (e.g., 2026).

title: Normalize phone numbers — normalize_phone
text: Normalizes phone numbers removing punctuation formatting consistent representation.

title: Normalize phone numbers — normalize_phone
code: normalize_phone(   phone,   format = c("dash", "digits", "e164"),   country = "US",   invalid = NA_character_,   allow_7 = FALSE,   keep_extension = FALSE,   extension_sep = " x",   strip_leading_country = TRUE,   na_if_blank = TRUE,   strict = TRUE )

title: Normalize phone numbers — normalize_phone
text: phone Character vector phone numbers. format Output format: "dash" (XXX-XXX-XXXX), "digits", "e164". country Country code e164 format (currently "US"). invalid Value return invalid phone numbers. allow_7 Logical; TRUE, allow 7-digit numbers format XXX-XXXX (dash) digits. keep_extension Logical; TRUE, retain extensions (e.g., x123). extension_sep Separator used appending extensions (default " x"). strip_leading_country Logical; TRUE, strips leading "1" 11-digit US numbers. na_if_blank Logical; TRUE, blank/whitespace-inputs become invalid. strict Logical; strict = TRUE, numbers must 10 digits (7 digits allow_7 = TRUE).

title: Normalize phone numbers — normalize_phone
text: character vector normalized phone numbers.

title: Normalize postal (ZIP) codes — normalize_zip
text: Normalizes US ZIP codes either 5-digit ("12345") ZIP+4 ("12345-6789") format removing punctuation whitespace. Postal codes treated character strings; leading zeros preserved.

title: Normalize postal (ZIP) codes — normalize_zip
code: normalize_zip(   postal,   format = c("zip5", "zip9", "digits"),   invalid = NA_character_,   strict = TRUE,   na_if_blank = TRUE )

title: Normalize postal (ZIP) codes — normalize_zip
text: postal Character vector postal codes. format Output format: "zip5" (always 5 digits), "zip9" (ZIP+4 available), "digits" (raw digits, 5 9). invalid Value return invalid postal codes. strict Logical; TRUE, accept exactly 5 9 digits cleaning. FALSE, attempt salvage taking first 5 digits least 5 present, first 9 digits least 9 present. na_if_blank Logical; TRUE, blank/whitespace-inputs become invalid.

title: Normalize postal (ZIP) codes — normalize_zip
text: character vector normalized postal codes.

title: fundr ggplot theme — theme_fundr
text: minimal theme fundraising-report friendly defaults.

title: fundr ggplot theme — theme_fundr
code: theme_fundr(   base_family = "montserrat",   base_size = 12,   plot_title_family = base_family,   plot_title_size = 16,   plot_title_face = "bold",   plot_title_margin = 10,   subtitle_family = base_family,   subtitle_size = 14,   subtitle_face = "plain",   subtitle_margin = 15,   strip_text_family = base_family,   strip_text_size = 10,   strip_text_face = "plain",   caption_family = base_family,   caption_size = 10,   caption_face = "italic",   caption_margin = 10,   axis_text_size = base_size,   axis_title_family = subtitle_family,   axis_title_size = 10,   axis_title_face = "plain",   axis_title_just = "rt",   plot_margin = NULL,   grid_col = "#cccccc",   grid = TRUE,   axis_col = "#cccccc",   axis = FALSE,   ticks = FALSE )

title: fundr ggplot theme — theme_fundr
text: base_family base font family base_size base font size, given pts. plot_title_family, plot_title_size, plot_title_face Title font family, size, face. plot_title_margin Bottom margin (points) plot title. subtitle_family, subtitle_size, subtitle_face Subtitle font family, size, face. subtitle_margin Bottom margin (points) subtitle. strip_text_family, strip_text_size, strip_text_face Facet strip text font family, size, face. caption_family, caption_size, caption_face Caption font family, size, face. caption_margin Top margin (points) caption. axis_text_size Axis tick label text size. axis_title_family, axis_title_size, axis_title_face Axis title font family, size, face. axis_title_just Two-character code controlling axis title justification; see Details. plot_margin Plot margin; defaults ggplot2::margin(30, 30, 30, 30). grid_col Color grid lines. grid Logical; TRUE show major+minor grids. character string, controls grids shown: include X/Y major x/y x/y minor x/y (e.g., "XY" "Xy"). axis_col Color axis lines (enabled). axis Logical; TRUE show axes. character string, controls axes shown (e.g., "x", "y", "xy"). ticks Logical; TRUE show axis ticks.

title: fundr ggplot theme — theme_fundr
text: ggplot2 theme object.

title: fundr ggplot theme — theme_fundr
text: axis_title_just interpreted two-character code, first character controls x-axis title (l, m/c, r) second controls y-axis title (b, m/c, t). default "rt" places x title right y title top.

title: fundr 0.0.0.9000
text: Initial development version. Added fiscal year helpers: fy_year(), fy_quarter(), fy_label(). Added optional Google Fonts helper: fundr_use_google_font(). Added ggplot2 theme: theme_fundr().
